Reviews.Title: “Hotel Indigo Berlin | Top Choice for Zoo Stop”
Reviews.Author: PinkiePorkchop
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel Indigo Berlin via google when looking for a place to stay en route back to the airport that was convenient but also interesting and fun (We were in Berlin on business and staying in Mitte most of the week). As designers we totally appreciated the supreme level of design and quality. The staff was super friendly and accommodating and super nice to give us penthouse rooms with huge decks and excellent views during both our one night stays, a week apart. Nice fitness center, too. And, a welcome back fruit plate waiting in our room when we checked back in with a note of appreciation for our business. Thank you, Hotel Indigo! (Plenty of shops and restaurants nearby, short walk to S train, U and bus to airport. Market 3 minute walk, design center two blocks away.)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Englishlee
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the brand new (opened 2 months) Hotel Indigo. Initial impressions were great, clean contemporary looking lobby, excellent friendly front desk staff, and we even got given a glass of bubbly to enjoy whilst we checked in. The rooms were also very contemporary (which we like) and as we'd been upgraded to an executive room we had a balcony overlooking part of the city. The rooms were however small, if I were staying any longer than a long weekend I think it would have been a struggle to cope with two people plus clothes etc. We did have one problem. When we got to our room there was a faint unpleasant smell, a bit like a drain. We put it down to the fact that they might have been working on the plumbing and went out to dinner. Overnight the smell got worse and the next day we asked to change rooms - which was no problem and was handled very graciously by the excellent front desk staff. This room was better but again overnight the smell started getting worse. Not sure what the problem is / was. Many of the drains around Berlin did whiff, so maybe the ventilation ducts on the roof was sucking in something like that. We also had breakfast at the hotel (included in the rate) which was very good and consisted of cold cheeses and meats, cereals, fruit, breads and if you wanted fried eggs, omelettes. Would I stay here again? Yes if the rates was good, as the location is great at just a 5 minute walk from the Zoo station and a similar distance from many restaurants etc and the hotel staff were also very good. But the management needs to figure out what the issue re the smell is.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: natisherre
Reviews.Content: New hotel-boutique, great design and good location in West Berlin. Friendly staff, always willing to cooperate. Well equipped rooms. The bed, matress and pillows are very comfortable. Wireless internet is included in the room rate. Breakfast very good but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: TheChadi
Reviews.Content: Located in Charlottenburg within walking distance to the Zoologischer Garten. In under 2 minutes walking you are at a train station with S-bahn, U-bahn, Tegel bus, bus and metro bus services to all over Berlin. The Airport Express train that takes to SXF and soon to the new Berlin airport also has a stop at this station. The location is also within a very close proximity to the famous Ku'damm and the Kaiser-Wilhelm Memorial Church (5 minutes on foot) with famous stores such as KaDaWe within 10 minutes walking. A supermarket is 2 minutes away which can cater to all your needs. In my opinion, the location is superb. The staff are very nice and helpful, small lobby, cozy feeling to the hotel. Two elevators that serve the small hotel which are more than enough. Never had a problem getting an elevator to go up or down. The rooms are nice, modern, well furnished, excellent bed, a bit smaller than normal but still decent in size I would say. The internet was fast, bathroom was nice and the shower was just great. The hotel in its entirety is very clean and found it to be spotless. I would highly recommend this hotel without reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Austrian_Airlines
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Indigo in berlin for 5 days in march. The hotel is brand new, great design and well located (for people who love to stay in west berlin). Staff are very nice, and provide good service. The rooms itself is well equipped - iPhone docking station, Coffee machine and well equipped bathroom. The bed is very comfortable. Wireless internet is included in the room rate, it's slow (you will not manage to watch a youtube video), but it's great for browsing the internet and emails. They have a small gym - which is not that bad for a small hotel. There are few drawbacks though, Some rooms are very small. I have changed the room to a larger one. The rooms on the 6th floor have balconies and are larger. The first room i have had does not have enough space for a couple with two suitcases. Breakfast is expensive - 17 Euros, which is way too much.

Reviews.Title: “Finally Something New”
Reviews.Author: Brian P
Reviews.Content: I am an avid traveller and most of the time on the road for my job. I am so tired of staying in the same hotels everywhere I go - it is so refreshing to find a new exciting, fresh hotel concept where at the same time I can earn my points. I found the interior of the hotel very inspiring and original - the staff was great and super friendly and knowledgable. I noted that some people have written that the rooms are small, but I did not get that impression - I loved my room and bed. I managed to get a lot of work done and getting free phone calls and internet was an extra plus and something that comes in handy. The breakfast was great and in particular I loved the fresh apple juice. I have stayed in lots of hotels in Berlin and throughout Germany. This has already become one of my favourite hotels. If you want to try something new and different I would highly recommend this hotel. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “NICE hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: NHNHNH
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel, great brand and great staff....like the local story and the whole feel off the hotel. great for business or leisure and gym is good too. problem is its too small!!! my room was tiny, i had no desk in my room and doubt i could fit one in even if they wanted too. shower was great/ bed was nice and comfortable just felt too compact and made me uncomfortable. i seen rooms on the top floor which were better but any other ones id opt for another hotel. its ashame as a big fan of indigo brand e.g shanghai, and i know the rest are not like this. reception area is nice, light and airy. was a bit confused by breakfast too as was not sure whether to go behind bar etc. it is brand new so obvs some teething issues just im not sure what can be done about room sizes.

Reviews.Title: “A new star in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Vagabonden
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a design that is modern and creative.No standard solutions here. Its graffiti decoration from Berlin really makes you experience the city while in the room. Excellent connection with wifi and discretely hidden wall plugs by the desk. High quality in all finishes. Breakfast buffet are delicacies of superb selection - where else would you get a buffalo mozarella and eggs to order. Here is attention to details! The staff are on level with this excellent hotel - true Berliners. If you want a hotel stay out of he ordinary - this is the place in Berlin!
